title: Advanced Unpacking Challenge
description:
Practice advanced unpacking patterns with the * operator.

Given: data = [10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70]

Unpack using these patterns:
1. Get first and rest: first, *rest
2. Get first, middle items, and last: first, *middle, last
3. Get first two and rest: a, b, *remaining

Print each result.

Expected output:
First: 10, Rest: [20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70]
First: 10, Middle: [20, 30, 40, 50, 60], Last: 70
First two: 10, 20, Remaining: [30, 40, 50, 60, 70]
starterCode:
# Data to unpack
data = [10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70]

# Pattern 1: First and rest
# TODO: Unpack first and rest

# Pattern 2: First, middle, last
# TODO: Unpack first, middle, last

# Pattern 3: First two and remaining
# TODO: Unpack a, b, and remaining
solution:
# Data to unpack
data = [10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70]

# Pattern 1: First and rest
first, *rest = data
print(f"First: {first}, Rest: {rest}")

# Pattern 2: First, middle, last
first, *middle, last = data
print(f"First: {first}, Middle: {middle}, Last: {last}")

# Pattern 3: First two and remaining
a, b, *remaining = data
print(f"First two: {a}, {b}, Remaining: {remaining}")
hints: Use * before a variable name to collect multiple values
The * collects all values not assigned to other variables

testCases.description: Should unpack first two and remaining
